I wish they can do pickups even for just 1-2 orders and have a pickup station so people have the option to order ahead then just grab and go if you're having a busy day at work and no time to order then fall in line. But.. I'll still come back here if I've got the time to get lunch because.. it's super clean, lean and the sauce on the side is AH-MAZING. Gosh, I can probably eat that thing with everything. Go try this place out! You won't regret it!
author: Anna Y.

description: Delicious -- tastes like what my mom makes at home. Absolutely in love with the flavorful soy sauce with ginger. Service was fast and friendly. Love that it comes with broth too. Will definitely come back for more!! (Order the original -- it's the only way you should eat it)
author: Annie K.

description: One of my favorite lunch spots. Simple & delicious - reminds me of eating a comfy meal at home. They also have a vegetarian (tofu) dish.
author: Michelle B.

description:
Authentic thai food, according to my thai friend.

Got the plain chicken and rice for about $10-$12.
The sauce that came with it was really, really good. Food itself was really plain, so I drowned the chicken in the sauce, habanero and sriracha, and it wasted really good.

A fine place. Meat a little too plain for me, but that's personal preference.

P.S.
Also, the chicken broth was insanely good.
This is definitely food to try. Its exceptional in its own way.
author: Subrat M.

description:
I fell in love with Kao Man Ghai from Nong's cart in Portland. I've searched everywhere for a similar alternative, even considered making the daunting dish at home.

That said, I was super excited when Rooster & Rice opened up right by my office but after my first visit there, I was unimpressed. The rice and chicken weren't very exciting, so I eagerly dipped the sauce, hot sauce, and slurped up some broth but the flavors didn't quite hit the mark for me. 

That said, there aren't many options in this exact area unless you go to Bun Mee down the street. Rooster & Rice is a solid healthy lunch in the area for a quick bite to eat.
author: Angie S.

description:
Delicious, clean-tasting and nutritious chicken on rice! 

Their menu is minimal with the necessities plus just enough accessories.

​The Original
breast and thigh with skin, jasmine white rice - $11.95
​
​The Marina
all breast, skinless, organic brown rice - $12.95
​
​The Vegetarian
organic tofu, brown rice, seasonal veggies - $9.95

​The Paleo
breast or thigh & seasonal veggies - $12.95

Extras:
Chicken $3     
Rice $2     
Broth $2     
Sauce (soybean, ginger) $1     
Egg (sous-vide) $2    
Veggies $2     
Drinks $3

Portion-wise, they give you a substantial amount of chicken. When I ordered The Paleo with all breast, it looked like 2 medium-sized breasts sliced up in total. The egg add-on comes in sous-vide form, seasonal veggies were steamed broccoli. There's also sliced cucumber, cilantro as garnish, chicken broth, and ginger soybean dipping sauce (flavor central!) that comes alongside. 

One thing to mention: habanero sauce. My meal was heightened to another level upon trying this guy out. It's complimentary at the napkin station; also sold in bottles at the counter. This sauce adds flavorful smokiness and gentle heat without taking over the entire dish. It's a phenomenal condiment.

Price-wise, I'd say it's fair in the competitive landscape among hipster chicken and rice businesses, the location, overall quality and portions. Extras, like the egg, are where they get ya. 

I could see this as an easy go-to lunch spot if you're in the area. 
Enjoy!
author: Karen W.

description:
Convinced the sugar daddy to pick this up on the way home from work, so I didn't get to try it until a few hours later... cold. Regardless, I still very much enjoyed the meal.

Got the original with a poached egg on top. Although I don't have anything to compare it to since this is my first thai style hainan chicken dish that I've tried, it was def pretty bomb. The sauce definitely is what makes the dish, otherwise it would be just meh. ~$14 is pretty steep for some boiled chicken and rice, but I guess these prices are expected in FiDi.
author: Annie N.

description: First time here. It was very tasty. Would go back. Got the Original. The only downfall is not a lot of seating but overall it's great.
author: Scot M.

description: The graphics caught my eye. I love the design and that their containers are compostable. The food is pretty good too!
author: Tammy N.

description: Yay finally made it to a R&R location! I LOVE Hainan Chicken & Rice! Got the Original and it was huge and delicious. Everything was flavorful, the sauce and the broth were both delicious. Two minor complaints. The rice was a bit dry, almost had a stale texture, for my preference, but I'm picky about my rice. It could be that's how the Thai style is supposed to be. The sauce wasn't garlicky enough for me. But that's probably a good thing... don't wanna be that person with vampire-killing breath at an afternoon meeting. I came super early 11:30 and ate there. They seemed to bang out orders fairly quickly with a couple of rushes. Yay new lunch options!
author: Nana L.

description:
One of many great asian spots around the city, but separates itself by offering a much healthier, less oily option, and sacrifices very, very little in the taste department at a reasonable price.

4.5 stars [review based on 'The Vegetarian' bowl]
author: Jasper D.

description:
I've been here a few time, and their food is pretty good. However, my only complaint is the wait time. First couple times were not bad, but the last time I was there I waited 17 mins from the time I ordered my food. They were not busy at all because I arrived at 11am, and there were only two people in front of me. No warning nor explanation nor apology from the staff. 

I personally wouldn't want to wait more than 5 mins for lunch on a work day, so I do not recommend this place if you need a quick lunch. There are better place in the area with more efficient service.
author: Bee T.

description:
https://www.yelp.com/biz/rooster-and-rice-san-francisco-8

Rooster & Rice in San Francisco does one thing and does it well.  Poached organic chicken over chicken rice. 3 locations to serve you.  The FiDi location of the restaurant gets very busy especially during lunch. Production time even off peak is slow.
 Picks:
The original ($11.95) Breast & Thigh w/skin, jasmine white rice is the clean and pure making for a nice tasty healthy meal.  The soup that comes
with it is really good. The hot and zesty chili, ginger, garlic, soybean sauce goes well with the meal. If you like this, be sure to try Hainan Chicken Rice at The Night Market in South SF.

https://www.yelp.com/biz/the-night-market-south-san-francisco-2

The Marina ($12.95) Breast, skinless, organic brown rice is not as good as the original version.  Drier, denser without skin.

Just OK:
None

Would not reorder:
None

Overall - Very Good
Food - Very Good
Decor - Very Good
Service - Good
Value - Good

Would we come back - Yes
author: Ellen H.

description: Great food and great service! Could be your good choice for grab and go. I ordered the original one with extra chicken and rice for sharing with my gf but the waitress give us another free cup of broth.  ps. Love both signature sauce and habanero sauce.
author: Ferrari D.

description: This is my go to spot to eat lunch when I'm downtown. I love the original. The soup is great and the haberno sauce with the chicken is the best if you want a little bit of spicy. Their chicken is very moist and is over rice with their sauce is great! I love this place!
author: Orion L.

description: I love the Rooster and Rice locations in Soma and the Marina. For some reason, I've just had terrible experiences at this location. The service has been rude and the food has been served to me cold or lukewarm and several occasions. I wish they would keep the quality and customer consistent across their locations. I'm on the hunt for a new lunch go-to spot now. Hopefully the turn things around at this location.
author: Craig D.

description: Only visited because there was a shorter line. But food was pretty good. Good portion, and very different than other fast food in the area. Rice, veggie and meat. I had the Paleo dish. It was a nice grab and go.
author: Pat S.

description:
When I'm craving a simple, filling and relatively healthy meal, I come here. The name explains it all, you get chicken and rice.

What I liked:
* Simple and filling. The Original which is what I normally get is just steamed chicken (breast and thigh) and rice (with a couple cucumber slices) as well as a soy based sauce on the side. It also comes with some chicken soup/broth on the side which which is a bit oily for my taste, but still not bad.
* Great hot sauce that you can get on the side. Pick the habanero over the sriracha unless you can't handle the heat very well. It's sweet and has enough kick to it that you can feel, but not enough to ruin your meal or stomach. I definitely wouldn't come here as often if they didn't have the habanero hot sauce.

What I didn't like:
* A bit pricey. With tax, you end up paying $13+ for a relatively normal meal.
* Limited seating. If you come here for dinner on a weekday, expect to wait for seating or get takeout.
* Usually a decent wait for your food, but I guess it doesn't exactly claim to be fast-food.
author: Michael M.

description: Really good meal but be prepared for a plane meal. Not in a bad way, just make sure you know what you're getting. I'm more of a saucey guy who likes heavy flavor. I'll give it one more shot though. Fairly healthy as well if that's what you're looking for. Portions are a bit small.  Staff was super friendly.
author: Matt N.

description: I came here for lunch and even though the line goes out the door, it is pretty quick! I love Rooster & Rice because even though it could be on the pricier side for lunch, it is well worth it if you are craving chicken and rice or want to treat yourself to a delicious meal. Everything in this restaurant is quality. From the chicken to the sauce and even the napkins. One thing to note is that the egg is $2! Depending on where you stand in line, it could look like it says $1 on the board, its a dollar difference, but I learned it the hard way..
author: Steph L.

description: Great place to pick up a quick and healthy lunch. Got the paleo, choice of poached breast or thigh meat with steamed broccoli and some cucumber slices. Sauce was good but has huge chunks of ginger (soy sauce wouldn't be strict paleo but they have a habenero and sriracha sauce). Gets pretty crowded during lunch so probably could call ahead but even still the order only takes 5mins or so to get ready. I do think it's a tad over priced but only by 1-2dollars.  Seating available for small groups, but limited.
author: Christina C.

description: Got the original and added veggies which is actually just broccoli and it was bomb. First time at R&R. Being Chinese, I am accustomed to chicken being prepped this way and it's quality ass fresh chicken that is super tasty. The chicken rice is amazing in itself. Drizzle the sauce it comes with over the chicken and enjoy this simple yet super satisfying meal. Good bye.
author: Ying Ci H.

description: First timer at rooster and rice. I was downtown searching for a good rice plate. I looked on yelp and this was the first to pop up. I've seen other people post about Rooster and Rice so I was always curious about it. None the less I ordered the original  I believe it is called. Very simple. Sometimes less is better. The chicken was boiled and was very tender. The sauce is what gives this meal a kick. I added sriracha and habanero sauce on top of the chicken as well. All and all a very simple chicken over rice plate.
author: Michael T.

description: I have no idea why there's a line at this place. $15 for bland, boiled chicken and bland white rice? There are a million options within a 2 block radius.
author: Matt M.

description:
Really enjoyed this spot! Stopped in for lunch and ordered The Original (breast and thigh meat with skin over white rice) and a bottle of Vitamilk soy milk.

Rice was flavorful, if a touch dry. Chicken was well-prepared; specifically, the breast pieces maintained their moisture. To quote Guy Fieri, the dipping sauce took me to Flavortown. Try mixing in some of their habanero sauce for an extra kick. Fresh chicken broth on the side was a nice touch.
author: Trevor M.

description: Hearty comfort food at a decent price. The menu is simple and the service is extremely fast. The chicken rice tastes a bit like the Singaporean Hainan chicken rice, which I'm more familiar with. They ran out of chicken breast today so I got all thigh meat, which is great because it's very juicy. I liked the garlic/ginger soy sauce. I added Sriracha on my chicken and it's very good. It comes with a cup of chicken soup and it goes well with the rice too. Overall, a very nice spot for a quick bite. Would come again.
author: Christine C.

description: Love eating here! The chicken is so moist and the rice is incredibly delicious! It's one of those meals that doesn't make you feel bad and gross afterwards. Although there's NO parking anywhere near this location since it's in the heart of downtown SF, if you're staying at a nearby hotel or happen to work around the area, it's a great alternative lunch or dinner spot to check out.
author: Jenna C.

description: Nice being able to order comfort Asian chicken and rice with simple menu.  I went on a very rainy day at 3:30 pm and there were only 5 patrons through my entire 30 minute chow down in house.   They offer free water from a cooler, small paper cups, disposable forks and spoons, Sriracha sauce, Habanero sauce, and thick napkins.  I am not sure if they have a Public bathroom.  You're intended to throw away your own trays and clean up after yourself when you eat there and not leave your mess on the table.  I deducted the star because no staff member wipes nor busses the tables after in-house dining  patrons leave their tables and their messes behind
author: Lark A.

description: This place is maybe $1-2 dollars overpriced, but the food is always cooked perfectly. The chicken is super moist and the sauces and broth they give add so much flavor. Service is always prompt and it's a great quick lunch grab.
author: Justin S.

description:
Love the chicken !! So nice to have it deboned . 
Just the right balance of flavors and sauce . 
Definitely coming back
author: Mei L.

description: This is one of the best lunches you can get in SF. I get the Marina with broccoli. The food is great, healthy, and you get a lot of it for a reasonable price. The service is great, usually never wait more than 5-8 minutes. Everything comes with broth which is another bonus. Highly suggest coming here for lunch, I only wish they were open on the weekends.
author: Mitchell S.

description: It's a pretty straight up healthy fast food place in Fidi. Dishes are consistent and it's fast service. Yelp asks me to keep writing but I don't think it's necessary. What is good is good, period. Keep it up, rooster and rice.
author: K Y.

description:
A pleasant surprise to my Taiwanese roots. Loved the chicken!! Delicious, juicy, tender, and just right. 

Portion was good, and the soup OH MAN.

Take your diverse friends here because I only saw Asians when I went and that's no fun
author: Joshua C.

description: I lived in Singapore for 3 years where chicken rice is a national dish. This was close. It also is putting a Thai spin on chicken rice. I ordered a double meat portion and could not finish. I'm 6'3 and 215 lbs. It was a darn good lunch. Simple but packed with flavor. Excellent sauce.
author: Clements J.

description: The first time I got the chicken and rice and it was pretty good. Loved the sauces and soup was tasty. The second time I went there, it didn't have the same charm as the first one but still delicious :-)
author: Wayne H.

description: Simple chicken and rice. The sauce is where things are happening and tie it all together. Lines gets long fast but it also moves fairly quickly
author: Henry T.

description: Great tofu dish with egg on top is the best. Order this at least 1-2 times a week. Simple easy and healthy. Would like to see more variety on menu, at least for sauces
author: Ken M.

description: Been to a few others in the city. Cold/luke warm chicken. This was dine in too. Oh well.
author: Walter K.

description: I just don't get it. People lining up to pay $14 for blander than bland, basic poached chicken and rice. Literally there is zero flavor without dousing everything with the hot sauce. So done with hyped-up places in SF charging high tariffs for sub-standard product. I'll be spending my hard-earned lunch money elsewhere.
author: Melanie D.

description: Quick, Decently Priced, Decent Quality. That's all that needs to describe this place. It's quick and simple. Comes with soup and sauce for your chicken. Can't go wrong.
author: Kevin W.

description: 3.5 stars. Yay! Finally one opened closer to my work. Must eat it with their special hot sauce. I don't think it's the best, but this is the only place around the Fidi that has something like this. Can't eat it all the time, but I like their broth and I get the all white meat no skin. Line moves fast and there's a good amount of seating.
author: Karen H.

description: Decent new vegan option in FiDi. The menu has about three options. The tofu is a little bland but the broth is good. A friend has come with and prefers the chicken with the skin if that's your thing. They are usually busy but the wait is never long.
author: Barie W.

description:
I've been going to Rooster & Rice at Filbert location back in 2016. But due to inconsistency issues, I hardly ever go back there. 

When they have the recipe right, it's amazing! The chicken is fragrant and juicy, the garlic rice is also fragrant with the perfect texture, and the chicken broth is good and soothing. They have really good habenaro sauce to go with it too.

But when they don't have the recipe right, it's a disappointment. Sometimes the chicken is dry and other times the rice is too hard or way too mushy. The inconsistency happened regularly.

So when they opened the FiDi location last year (2017), which is somewhat near my work, I've decided to stop by for a try. I stood in their long line full of excitement because I haven't had it for a while. 

Of course, when I took my first bite, I regretted it. Their rice was hard, and the portion of the meat was tiny. I had an assumption that they were still working out their kinks at this new location, so I've decided to not go back until I've given them enough time to get settled.

Today was the day I've decided to go back... and I'd have to say, it's a lot better than the first time. The broth is not too salty, and the portion of meat is perfect. Unfortunately, I found the meat a bit dry, rice was a bit mushy but tolerable, and the raw sliced cucumber tasted old. Again, it's inconsistent.

I will go back there when I'm craving for something warm and hearty, and my stress level's so high at work that I needed comfort food (I'm Asian who grew up with Singapore's Hainan Chicken Rice, which is MY comfort food) but it won't be my go-to place. 

FYI, I would never compare Rooster & Rice with Singapore's Hainan Chicken Rice. It's slightly different, especially the sauce that comes with it. Rooster & Rice says they serve Thai Chicken Rice. Anyways, whether you're craving for a chicken rice version from Singapore or Thailand, let's be less critical and give Rooster & Rice props for introducing and making this Asian dish popular in this liberal city.
author: Summer O.

description: Yummy! Wish they had some appetizers (like fried chicken skin) on a more regular basis. Overall - quick and yummy!
author: Joy S.

description: This is a cheap and fast restaurant in an expensive part of town. The menu is tiny, which translates into fresh food served quickly. The sauces are tasty. The decor is spartan. It's bare bones and it's done well. Bathrooms weren't very clean.
author: John B.

description: We got the original plate.  Priced at $11, the portions are good enough to get you full.  The soy/vinegar sauce was good, and had the right tang.  The chicken was very tender so that was it went down very well!
author: Ben S.

description: Really good. Though it's Thai, it reminds me of Singaporean chicken rice. Had it back to back days .
author: Banu S.

description: Pretty good Hainan Chicken with rice. Rice was tasty. Wait wasn't bad but like most places in SF, seating is limited. I would probably come back again during an "off-time" or get to go.
author: Deb L.

description: I got an order of all dark meat. This combination with the sauce and rice is bonkers! The secret sauce has flavors of ginger, soy, black bean. It's the best to mix with the smooth chicken meat. It doesn't seem to be too unhealthy for a takeout choice. Rice and chicken with a side of soup makes this an easy, relatively healthier option for your quick weekday meal. I'll be back as often as I can! Check out the location on 2nd St too.
author: Alias A.

description: Had original to go +$2 for steamed broccoli came out to $15.! Price of food in the FiDi i guess. Came w broth at least. Taste like "tinolang manok" if Ure filipino.
author: art t.

description: Great food, I get it three or four times a week. However, their chicken gave me and my coworkers food poisoning last week (end of February 2018).
author: Matthew L.

description: Love this place. It smells like heaven when I step my feet in there. And as expected, the food is great! I came from South East Asia, so this hits home to my pallete. I love putting some soup on my rice, which will enhance the flavor of the chicken so much more. Definately going back for more chicken rice!
author: Cherice C.

description: Meh. I picked this up because I was starving and it was close to my hotel. The poached chicken had skin and some other gross stuff on it. The rice was fine. The sauce did have a bit of spice. It was a let down.
author: Sara R.

description: glad this restaurant has expanded, spreading the thai hainan chicken rice.  still enjoyable portion and deceptively simple very yummy sauce and rice.
author: Rob C.

description: Definitely not as good an experience as my last visit. They lost my order, which whatever, shit happens. The bigger problem was that everything except the broth was cold -- not just not hot, but cold. Cold chicken and broccoli might ok with some folks, but no one wants to eat a c
author: Erica W.

description:
All four of us got food poisoning the next day, which seems like it has to be from the chicken. That put a damper on things. :/ 

Food was tasty overall, but the chicken breast was a little dry. Make sure to mix in the included sauce, it was slightly bland without it.
author: Raymond J.

description: Sweet jesus this place is simple and delicious! It's like having a piece of Singapore in your backyard...but via Bangkok? Who cares. The chicken is good and the dark umami bean sauce will blow your damn mind!
author: M G.

description:
Great food, great service.

I ordered The Original and my wife had the The Marina. Base meal was good. The habanero sauce put it over the top.
author: Joshua K.

description: Finally a location in the middle of somewhere the food says it all healthy, delicious, and simple.
author: N A.

description: Absolutely overhyped garbage. Plain chicken that tastes like nothing with about a pound of rice. They give you siracha and a broth that has minimal flavor that you are supposed to douse the chicken with, With as much hot sauce and broth as you need, might as well eat fried chicken or a chipotle chicken burrito bowl. Staff was nice and place was clean though
author: Mike M.

description: Today I had the original, with steamed broccoli for extra $2 dollars. Rice is very tasty. Broth is really rich. Chicken is tender. Overall a good meal!
author: Nozima T.

description: Good classic Hunan chicken! Limited menu but good place to go if you want Hunan chicken!
author: Erik L.

description: The portions are huge, but I honestly think I could make this at home. I got the Original which is $12 and added veggies an an egg for an extra charge. Including tax it came out to $18 OUCH.
author: Cassie J.

description: Had the original + extra chicken. Really like their fast, convenient and healthy food. Love the sauce! Broth is a bit of salty.
author: Dan C.

description: Has really good flavor!! The service is super fast and people are very nice! The rice is packed with flavor ..and the chicken is soft and actually tasty!
author: Divya B.

description: I want to give it 3.5 stars because it's good but not enough to drive me insane so 3 it is, very simply made but I prefer more spice if you will
author: Nathan H.

description: I've had all the West Coast Chicken and Rice from Portland to LA. Rooster and Rice beats everyone by far with favor, consistency, and service. I've been going the Marina location to cure my hangovers for 2 years now. Sometimes they have chicken skin! FIRE! When they opened a 2nd location, it changed my life because they started doing delivery. Now they have this location and I'm downtown for work all the time. There's a few chicken and rice places that just opened but none are as fuego as this shit right here.
author: Alex P.

description: Taste great, chicken was juicy and firm together with fermented soybean sauce and habanero sauce. I would say 10-10-10. Place was clean and all staff was so nice :) would recommend
author: Edward O.

description: Simple, quick and delicious... this is basically Thai-style hainan chicken, which is all that they do but it's great. Restaurant design is new and minimalist and designed to be more like a fast food store.
author: Emile L.

description: Super yummy and super tender chicken! Simple but delicious. Gets really busy during lunch but it's great quality. Price is comparable to the area.
author: Daisy S.

description: This is one of my favorite places to get a healthy dinner.  It has a delicious homemade taste and is super quick to pick up.  The original is the thing to get, but if you want a bit of greenery add on a side of veggies.
author: A C.

description: Love the original chicken rice, which is pretty much the Hainan chicken. The chicken rice and the chicken work so well together. It really brings thr flavor of chicken to life, not to mention the broth was also very tasty. Wish this is a bigger portion but still give it a 5 stars because of how good it tasted.
author: Jing W.

description: Food is good, but portions of the food price little too much. Service not too good. Really need to improve.  The time I'm been there I leave a tip. Probably won't  go back there.
author: Jeff T.

description: It's good for what it is and for some of us, this is comfort food.  But it's very simple and it's very expensive. For a plate with rice and poached chicken, you will paying about $15+.  And the broth literally tastes like Swanson's out of a can.
author: Diana M.

description: very delicious and quick serve. there's a similar place like this in Portland and it's super comparable :-)
author: Vienna H.
